channel.title: Arch Linux Install Question
channel.description:
Hey all. I have two hard drives like this:
[url=http://img178.imageshack.us/img178/2381/screenshot1wi1.png][img]http://img178.imageshack.us/img178/2381/screenshot1wi1.th.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://img90.imageshack.us/img90/9866/screenshot2ch4.png][img]http://img90.imageshack.us/img90/9866/screenshot2ch4.th.png[/img][/url]
First hard drive is for Windows stuff. First partition of second hard drive contains Ubuntu Linux. I use GRUB as a bootloader. I want to install ArchLinux to HDB3 but I don't want GRUB overwritten or anything. Is it possible to add a menu entry to GRUB to boot ArchLinux without disturbing the entries for Windows and Ubuntu Linux?

item.title: Arch Linux Install Question
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

It’s piss easy to install tbh. Just follow the instructions.

Read full topic

item.title: Arch Linux Install Question
item.dc:creator: @solarwind solarwind
item.description:
@solarwind wrote:

No, I can’t overwrite Windows, I need it for school stuff. And I love Ubuntu. If I like Arch, I will overwrite Ubuntu.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 21, 2008, 12:50:32 AM[/size][hr]Wow, Arch Linux is a pain in the ass to install…

Read full topic

item.title: Arch Linux Install Question
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

Overwrite Windows and Ubuntu. Arch is worth it.

Read full topic
